articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets LPRP Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets LPRP Delegation
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today met and had a friendly talk with the delegation of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party (LPRP) led by Thongloun Sisoulith, member of the Political Bureau and chairman of the Commission for External Affairs of the Central Committee of the party who is vice-prime minister and minister of foreign affairs of the Lao government, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.
					Thongloun Sisoulith said that during his visit to the DPRK he was deeply impressed to see the Korean people working hard to vigorously accelerate the building of a great prosperous powerful socialist nation while smashing the moves of the imperialists under the leadership of General Secretary        Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Noting that the country's reunification is the unanimous desire of the Korean people, he expressed belief that the Korea would certainly be reunified.
					
					 He said that he would make positive effort to develop the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries provided by President Kaysone Phomvihane and President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Present there were Kim Thae Jong, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and Chaleune Warinthrasak, Lao ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Agreement Signed between WPK and LPRP
articles.content:
Agreement Signed between WPK and LPRP
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- A 2008-2010 agreement on the cooperation and the exchange of delegations between the Workers' Party of Korea and the Lao People's Revolutionary Party (LPRP) was signed in Pyongyang on Oct. 21.
					 Present at the signing ceremony were Secretary Choe Thae Bok and Vice Department Director Kim Thae Jong of the Central Committee of the WPK and officials concerned from the WPK side and the members of the delegation of the LPRP led by Thongloun Sisoulith, member of the Political Bureau and chairman of the Commission for External Affairs of the Central Committee of the party who is vice-prime minister and minister of foreign affairs of the Lao government, and Lao Ambassador to the DPRK Chaleune Warinthrasak from the opposite side.
					
					 The agreement was inked by Choe Thae Bok and Thongloun Sisoulith.

articles.title: Delegation of LPRP Feted
articles.content:
Delegation of LPRP Feted
Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea arranged a reception for the visiting delegation of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party at the People's Palace of Culture on Tuesday. 
					Present there on invitation were members of the party headed by Thongloun Sisoulith, member of the Political Bureau and chairman of the Commission for External Affairs of the Central Committee of the party who is vice-prime minister and minister of foreign affairs of the Lao government, and Chaleune Warinthrasak, Lao ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					Present there were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the WPK Central Committee, and others and officials concerned.
					
					Choe Thae Bok said, addressing the reception, that the WPK is pleased with the fact that the Lao people have achieved success in the struggle to implement the decision of the 8th Congress of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party.
					
					Noting that it is the common desire of the two peoples to boost the friendly relations between the two parties and the two countries provided by President Kim Il Sung and Kaysone Phomvihane, he expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two parties and the two countries would grow stronger thanks to their joint efforts.
					
					 Thongloun Sisoulith said in his speech that the WPK and the fraternal Korean people have achieved great successes in defending the country and socialist construction. 
					
					 He stressed that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and the two countries with a long history and tradition have grown stronger under the deep concern of General Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 He said that the Lao party, government and people are rejoiced over the fact that the WPK and the Korean people are accelerating the building of a great prosperous powerful socialist nation, true to the Songun idea, and extend congratulations to them.

articles.title: Greetings to Mongolian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Mongolian President
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Oct. 14 sent a message of greetings to Mongolian President Nambariin Enkhbayar on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Mongolia. 
					 Kim in his message expressed belief that the DPRK-Mongolia relations of good-neighborliness and friendship with a long-standing history and tradition would grow stronger in all fields in the future, too. He wished the Mongolian people prosperity and welfare and the president fresh success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Greetings to Mongolian FM
articles.content:
Greetings to Mongolian FM
Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun on Oct. 14 sent a message of greetings to Mongolian Foreign Minister S. Batbold on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the opening of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and Mongolia.
					 The message noted that over the past six decades since the establishment of diplomatic relations the two countries have closely supported and cooperated with each other through brisk visits and exchange on the principle of mutual respect for sovereignty, equality and mutual benefits.
					
					It expressed belief that the long-standing good neighborly friendship between the two countries would steadily expand and develop in conformity with the desire and interests of the two peoples in the future, too, and hoped that the relations and cooperation between the two foreign ministries for the improvement of the relations between the two countries would grow stronger, wishing him success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Reception Given by Mongolian Foreign Ministry
articles.content:
Reception Given by Mongolian Foreign Ministry
Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- A reception was given by the Mongolian Ministry of Foreign Affairs on Oct. 13 on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Mongolia.
					Present there on invitation were personages of various social strata including officials of several ministries and chiefs of the organizations for the study of the Juche idea and the DPRK ambassador to Mongolia and staff members of his embassy.
					
					S. Batbold, foreign minister of Mongolia, addressing the reception, noted that this year marking the 20th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's visit to Mongolia and the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the two countries is a significant year, referring to the fact that Kim Il Sung performed great feats for the development of the bilateral relations, paying visits to Mongolia on two occasions, and the peoples of the two countries have made efforts to boost the relations in line with the common desire and interests while supporting and cooperating with each other.
					
					 He said that he was pleased with the fact that the diligent Korean people have achieved great successes by making efforts to achieve the peaceful reunification of the country, build a great prosperous powerful nation and greet the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung with successes in the efforts for the development and prosperity of the country with confidence and strong will under the leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Saying that it is the consistent stand of Mongolia to boost the relations between the two countries, he evinced his will to closely cooperate with the DPRK, in the future, too.

articles.title: Congratulatory Message to PM of Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to PM of Democratic Congo
Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Kim Yong Il on Oct. 21 sent a congratulatory message to Adolphe Muzito upon his appointment as Prime Minister of the Democratic Republic of Congo. 
					 The message wished him big success in his work to consolidate the national reconciliation and unity and peace and reconstruct economy.

articles.title: Foreign Delegations Here
articles.content:
Foreign Delegations Here
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Syrian Trade Unions Federation headed by its President Mohammed Shaban Azzooz who is president of the World Federation of Trade Unions and a delegation of the Zamfara State Government of the Federal Republic of Nigeria led by its Executive Governor Alh. Mahmud Aliyu Shinkafi arrived here today.

articles.title: Earlier Settlement of Issue of "Comfort Women" Urged
articles.content:
Earlier Settlement of Issue of "Comfort Women" Urged
Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Japan should settle the issue of "comfort women" as early as possible, clearly understanding the trend of the times in which sincere apology and reparation are made to redeem the crime-woven past although more than half a century has passed since the end of the Second World War, urged the DPRK delegate addressing the meeting of the 3rd Committee of the 63rd UN General Assembly on Oct. 14.
					To eliminate all forms of discrimination against women and ensure equality between the men and women is the consistent policy of the government of the DPRK which considers the Juche idea centering on man as a guiding principle, he said, and went on:
					
					It would be unthinkable about the progress of women at present and in the future, still less the settlement of the issue without the full redemption of past.
					
					The sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army imposed by Japan upon 200,000 Korean women during the period of its occupation of Korea is a hideous crime against humanity and an important human rights issue that should be settled under any circumstances.
					
					The world history does not know such precedence as forcing girls in their teens into sexual slavery, taking them to battlefields.
					
					Nevertheless, the Japanese authorities have totally refused sincere apology and reparation to the victims while failing to admit the state responsibility for the crime of "comfort women."
					
					The negation of evident crime is little short of adding another crime to those already committed and a declaration that it would repeat such crimes in the future, too.
					
					We remind Japan of the fact that the resolutions were adopted even at parliaments in various Western countries over the past one year demanding Japan's repentance and apology for the above-said crime.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Fascist Suppression Assailed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Fascist Suppression Assailed
Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Recently the Lee Myung Bak group arrested the executive chairman of the Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration on charges of violation of the ill-famed "National Security Law" (NSL), timed to coincide with its suppression of the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration of south Korea. 
					A spokesman for the North Headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification (Pomchonghakryon) issued a statement on Oct. 21 denouncing this action.
					
					The statement said: No sooner had the group of traitors come to power than unsheathed the sword of fascism and arrested the chairman of the South Headquarters of Pomchonghakryon on charges of violation of the NSL and persecuted and excruciated him and imposed a heavy penalty upon him in the end. It is keen now to totally eliminate the "south Korean Council of Youth Organizations" which took the lead in the struggle for independence, democracy and reunification in south Korea after labeling it "enemy-benefiting."
					
					The North Headquarters of Pomchonghakryon vehemently denounces the Lee group's evermore brutal suppression as an undemocratic and anti-reunification action to quell the ardent desire and will of youth and students to defend and implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and bring back the past era of fascist dictatorship to south Korea, the statement noted, and continued:
					
					The Lee group's acts of incriminating those youth and students engaged in the just patriotic struggle for reunification and brutally suppressing them go to prove that it is keen only on the confrontation with the north and fascist dictatorship, negating the said declarations.
					
					The puppet authorities should stop the suppression of the progressive pro-reunification patriotic forces at once and immediately release the unreasonably detained youth, students and patriotic figures, bearing in mind that they will only meet destruction if they keep to the road of confrontation and fascism quite contrary to the fellow countrymen's desire for reunification.

articles.title: National August 3 Mass Consumption Goods Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
National August 3 Mass Consumption Goods Exhibition Opens
Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- A national August 3 mass consumption goods exhibition was opened here on Tuesday.
					Displayed there are goods produced by factories and enterprises, housewives' production work-teams of ris, townships and districts (dongs), reutilization production work-teams of direct sales shops of cities and counties and home workers for welfare service from across the country.
					
					On display in the provincial order are at least 10,000 kinds of tens of thousands of consumer goods produced with raw materials and internal reserves available in localities.
					
					 Ho Thae Gwon, vice-minister of Light Industry, made an address at the opening ceremony.
					
					 Then the participants went round the exhibition.
					
					Various kinds of goods produced by producers of consumption goods in Pyongyang and provinces by tapping and mobilizing internal reserves drew attention of the participants as they fully reflected tastes of the people and their requirement for the livelihood.

articles.title: Staff of Indonesian Embassy Do Friendship Labor
articles.content:
Staff of Indonesian Embassy Do Friendship Labor
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Bambang Daranindra, charge d' affaires ad interim, and the staff members of the Indonesian embassy here did friendship labor at the DPRK-Indonesia Friendship Yaksu Cooperative Farm in Kangso County, South Phyongan Province on Oct. 22.
					 The guests helped farmers in rice threshing.
					
					 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, too, the charge d' affaires wished the farm greater successes in the agricultural production.
					
					 The embassy officials handed aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Highly Praised
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Highly Praised
Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Riad Youness, deputy of the Director of the School of Syria's Baath Arab Socialist Party who visited the DPRK, praised General Secretary Kim Jong Il as a great man with steadfast faith, indomitable will and matchless courage and grit.
					Kim Jong Il has pursued the original Songun politics and turned the DPRK into an ever-victorious powerful state, he noted, and continued:
					
					The world people are highly praising him as a prominent leader glorifying the DPRK with the Songun politics.
					
					The reality of the DPRK goes to prove that the Songun politics serves as an all-powerful treasured sword that guarantees the happiness of the people.
					
					He expressed conviction that the army and people of the DPRK would always win victories in the future, too, true to the leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Brilliant Model of South-South Cooperation
articles.content:
Brilliant Model of South-South Cooperation
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung, who dedicated his whole life to the happiness of the people, made much effort for the development of agriculture in developing countries.
					 Having paid a deep attention to the social progress and economic independence in African countries from many years before, he indicated the ways for the agricultural development of the countries at the consultative meeting of the ministers of agriculture from Eastern and Western Africa who attended the Symposium of the Non-aligned and Other Developing Countries on Increasing Food and Agricultural Production held in Pyongyang on August 31, Juche 70 (1981).
					
					 In his speech "For the Development of Agriculture in African Countries" made at the consultative meeting he gave clear-cut answers to the problems arising in the improvement of farming methods, seed, fertilizer, farm machine, irrigation and training of agro-technicians, saying that it was important, first of all, to accelerate the development of agricultural science and technology and, for this purpose, agricultural research centers should be established.
					
					 Subsequently the Kim Il Sung Institute of Agricultural Science and Chollima Institute of Agricultural Science were established respectively in Guinea and Tanzania. He saw to it that the DPRK sent agro-technicians and irrigation facilities and farm machines to African countries to render technical assistance to the agricultural production there.
					
					 As a result, the irrigation setups and farm implement factories were built in Mozambique, Rwanda, Tanzania, Ethiopia and many other African areas thanks to the warm care of the President.
					
					 A village in Tanzania produced 7.2 tons of maize per hectare in the dry fields where it harvested 0.5-0.8 ton and many villages, farms and cooperatives in Ghana, Zambia and Ethiopia reaped bumper crops with the help of Korean agro-technicians. 
					
					 His care for solving the food problem in developing countries was shown not only for such African countries as Madagascar, Uganda and Congo but for other countries.
					
					Hugh Desmond Hoyte, ex-President of Guyana, was excited to see rich crops and said that the bumper harvest was thanks to President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il who sent machines and technicians and taught him how to guide the rural work and he should extend gratitude to them.
					
					 As figures and publications of many countries across the world lavished praises, the brilliant model of the South-South cooperation was created by the President's love and concern for the people and his great exploits will shine long along with the history of mankind.

articles.title: Peasant Dance, Traditional Folk Dance
articles.content:
Peasant Dance, Traditional Folk Dance
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- The folk dance "peasant dance" attracted the attention of the audience of the mass gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" held in Pyongyang.
					 It is a folk dance of Korea that people had danced to the peasant music from a long time ago.
					
					 The dance, based on the song and dance gathering related with the labor and daily life in the primitive and ancient times, developed into a popular folk art of various forms in the historical period of the middle and modern ages.
					
					 The peasant dance is done together by the players of small gong, gong, janggo (a Korean drum), drum, snare drum and other instruments and masque dancers depicting different characters.
					
					 The dressings of the dancers are beautiful and suitable to the dynamic and rhythmic movements of the dance.
					
					 As the peasant dance was performed by men, its movements were virile.
					
					 Turning round tassels decorated with pheasant feather or a long paper is a unique one that can be seen only in the Korean peasant dance. 
					
					 When a dancer wearing tasseled hat dances round in various forms, turning a 12-fathom-long tassel, it presents a fascinating and cheerful scene deep in national color.
					
					 The national contest of agricultural working people's peasant dance is held in Pyongyang every year amid deep interest of the people.

articles.title: KCNA Slams Japan's Dishonest Stance towards Issue of Fulfillment of Its Commitment
articles.content:
KCNA Slams Japan's Dishonest Stance towards Issue of Fulfillment of Its Commitment
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Japan's act of vitiating the atmosphere of the six-party talks is causing furor in the international community.
					 Japan extended the sanctions against the DPRK and is insisting that it cannot render energy assistance to it as agreed upon at the six-party talks for the mere reason that the "abduction issue" has not been settled.
					
					 The "abduction issue," being an issue to be handled between the DPRK and Japan, has been discussed between the two sides and, therefore, it does not allow any other country to meddle in it, much less being a matter to be taken up at the six-party talks.
					
					 This notwithstanding, Japan refuses to fulfill the commitments it is obliged to honor on the principle of "action for action" while linking the issue with the six-party talks. This cannot be construed otherwise than a desperate bid of those bereft of reason.
					
					 As already reported, the U.S. recently announced a decision to cross the DPRK off the list of "state sponsors of terrorism". Japan, however, very much displeased with it, is trying hard to disturb the process for the settlement of the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 To make everything clear as regards the "abduction issue" so much touted by Japan, the DPRK has so far made every possible effort for its settlement.
					
					 At the Shenyang talks in August it was agreed to take specific actions to settle the inglorious past and the pending issues between the DPRK and Japan. Both sides confirmed the plan to conduct reinvestigation into the "abduction issue" on the basis of the agreement and detailed matters including its modality, methods and period.
					
					The "abduction issue" much touted by Japan does not stand comparison with such crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists against humanity in the past as the forcible drafting of more than 8.4 million Koreans, massacre of more than one million Koreans and forcing 200,000 Korean women into sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army, the crimes it has left unsettled. That is why the world considers the measure taken by the DPRK as a magnanimous bold decision made out of broad perspective.
					
					 Japan, however, has responded to the DPRK's sincerity with systematic perfidy and is only doing something obstructive to the settlement of issue.
					
					 As a matter of fact, Japan has never cooperated with the DPRK in the settlement of the "abduction issue".
					
					 It has always broken its promises. To cite just a few examples, it refused to send back those who had gone to Japan to visit home quite contrary to its earlier promise and escalated sanctions against the DPRK although it promised to lift part of them. It even savagely cracked down upon Koreans in Japan, reneging on its promise to protect their rights. Japan responded to the DPRK's repeated magnanimous steps by whipping up the bitterness toward the DPRK and chauvinism against Koreans and escalating the sanctions against it.
					
					 Japan's attitude remained unchanged even after the Shenyang talks. In a bid to convince the world that the talks handled the "abduction issue" only Japan hyped the agreed point concerning the "abduction issue" only among several points agreed while ignoring or downplaying other issues for the purpose of fanning up hostility toward the DPRK, when conveying their accounts. It thus craftily evaded the obligation to take practical measures for creating atmosphere favorable to the improvement of the bilateral relations.
					
					 The course in which the "abduction issue" was discussed and handled between the DPRK and Japan helps the former clearly understand that political forces in Japan have used the issue as a mere lever for meeting such sinister purposes as stay in power or seizure of power.
					
					 What merits attention is that after its emergence in Japan the Aso regime only staged a charade to give impression that it respects the agreement reached between the DPRK and Japan during the Fukuda regime and, in fact, it has stuck to the hostile policy pursued by the Abe Cabinet towards the DPRK. 
					
					 Japan's refusal to abide by the principle of "action for action" while linking the "abduction issue" with the six-party talks is aimed to scuttle the talks and justify its hostile moves toward the DPRK and its serious human rights abuses against Koreans in Japan.
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that if Japan is allowed to participate in the talks it would create only complexities in their way as it lets loose sheer sophism that the process of the denuclearization should not be allowed to make any progress unless the "abduction issue" is settled while standing in the way of its settlement.
					
					 The DPRK is compelled to raise a question as to whether there is any need to have the six-party talks attended by Japan as it is challenging the agreement reached at the talks. 
					
					 Japan had better drop its foolish attempt to use the talks aimed at the denuclearization as a platform for achieving the aim sought by it through the "abduction issue," cogitating about the consequences to be entailed by its mean behavior.

articles.title: Japan Accused of Disturbing Six-Party Talks
articles.content:
Japan Accused of Disturbing Six-Party Talks
Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Recently Japan dastardly decided to extend its sanctions against the DPRK for another six months. It is now behaving so shamelessly as to insist that it would not fulfil its commitment to make economic compensation on which an agreement was reached among the six parties unless progress is made in the solution of the "abduction issue". This demeanor of Japan comes under fire by a signed commentary of Rodong Sinmun Wednesday. 
					 Japan's dastardly behavior is nothing but a silly fuss made by the above-said disturber of the six-party talks ostracized there, the commentary notes, and goes on: 
					
					 The above-said talks are not a platform for discussing the "abduction issue" but are aimed at finding a solution to the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					Japan has so far persistently raised the "abduction issue" at the talks, the issue which has nothing to do with the discussion of the agenda of the talks, creating complexities and obstacles in their way. 
					
					 Japan has never tried to implement the issues discussed and agreed upon by the six parties under the pretence of solving the "abduction issue" and conducted hectic diplomacy to persuade the U.S. not to cross the DPRK off the list of "state sponsors of terrorism."
					
					Japan was disgruntled and displeased with the U.S. measure to delist the DPRK as "a state sponsor of terrorism".  This is little short of putting a brake on the implementation of the Oct. 3 agreement and standing up against the above-said talks. 
					
					 It is useless and an act of wasting time to try to discuss and solve pending issues with such state as Japan which reneges on everything,  changing its attitude and going this or that way whenever a regime changes.
					
					They are misleading the public opinion by creating impression that there is no progress in the settlement of the pending issues between the DPRK and Japan due to the lack of sincerity on the part of the former. 
					
					Japan's claim that the above-said measure taken by the U.S. is a sort of "concession" and "betrayal" is little short of tarnishing its image itself. 
					
					 Japan's attempt to use the six-party talks as a platform for realizing its selfish ambition is nothing but a behavior of a short-sighted political pigmy.
					
					 To make economic compensation to the DPRK is the commitments the other five parties to the talks are obliged to fulfill under the Oct. 3 agreement. How to approach this agreement may advance the above-said talks or put them at a stalemate. 
					
					Japan's insistence that it will not participate in the above-said economic compensation means deliberately neglecting and disturbing the implementation of the Oct. 3 agreement. This is intended to torpedo the talks, in the final analysis. 
					
					It is the ulterior intention of Japan to create hurdles and complexities in the way of the talks at any cost in a bid to block the solution of the issue and steadily strain the situation on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Japan had better come to its senses, though belatedly, and stop such foolish an act as lifting an axe to drop it on its own foot.

articles.title: Remarks of S. Korean Minister of "Unification" Dismissed as Sheer Sophism
articles.content:
Remarks of S. Korean Minister of "Unification" Dismissed as Sheer Sophism
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- The south Korean minister of "Unification" asserted that the inter-Korean relations deteriorated because the north insisted on the implementation of the October 4 declaration. What he uttered is too brazen-faced and outrageous outbursts against reunification to be overlooked. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a signed commentary. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 He is a diehard anti-reunification maniac who should have been judged by the nation for having played a leading role in bedeviling the inter-Korean relations, taking the lead in implementing the "pragmatic government's" anti-DPRK confrontational policy. Nevertheless, this guy is now craftily working to shift the responsibility for the deteriorated inter-Korean relations onto the DPRK, turning white to black. This is an unbearable provocation to the DPRK and unpardonable mockery of all the Koreans desirous of national reconciliation and reunification.   
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group is now keen to lay the blame for the catastrophic situation created in the inter-Korean relations, far from admitting its crimes committed against reunification. This clearly suggests that the group of traitors will throw a stumbling block in the way of developing the inter-Korean relations while sticking to the anti-DPRK confrontational policy. 
					
					The Lee group's desperate efforts to dodge the strong protest and denunciation from the public at home and abroad and justify its anti-reunification acts would get it nowhere. 
					
					 The Lee group can never evade the responsibility for having pushed the inter-Korean relations to a catastrophic crisis quite contrary to the need of the times and the desire of the nation and will have to pay a dear price for this crime.

articles.title: Sinister Aim Sought by Lee Myung Bak Blasted
articles.content:
Sinister Aim Sought by Lee Myung Bak Blasted
Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- The sinister aim sought by the Lee Myung Bak group in trumpeting about "the lost decade" is to downplay and bring to naught the achievements made in the June 15 era of reunification, justify its policy of confrontation with the DPRK and bring back the inter-Korean relations to those of acute confrontation in the past, observes Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a signed commentary.
					It goes on:
					
					The Lee clique of traitors' talk about "the lost decade" is, in essence, a blatant challenge to the DPRK and all Koreans who have made every sincere effort to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country. It is nothing but an undisguised declaration of anti-reunification confrontation and a proclamation of a war of aggression against the north as it betrays the intention to block national reunification, negating the north-south joint declarations, and provoke a war against the north in league with foreign forces. 
					
					The commentary cites concrete facts to prove that as soon as the group of traitors seized power, it pursued the criminal moves to overturn the landmark achievements made in the June 15 era of reunification in contravention of the spirit of the north-south joint declarations and began brutally cracking down upon the people from all walks of life aspiring after the country's reunification by linking them with the north, thus fanning up the atmosphere of confrontation with it. 
					
					 The Lee group is working with bloodshot eyes to sell off the interests of the nation to foreign forces in order to seek its wealth and luxury and meet its greed for power, serve the purposes of confrontation and war and push the inter-Korean relations to collapse. This is the thrice-cursed unpardonable group of quislings.
					
					 The hue and cry persistently raised by the Lee group over the "lost decade" while denying the north-south joint declarations and the idea of "By our nation itself" are an intolerable challenge to all the compatriots calling for the development of the inter-Korean relations and the unity of the nation and independent reunification.
					
					 The inter-Korean relations can never be normalized as long as the Lee group is allowed to persistently pursue confrontation and war in violation of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration supported and approved by all Koreans in a bid to bring back the June 15 era of reunification to those of north-south confrontation in the past.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group Branded as War Servants for U.S.
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group Branded as War Servants for U.S.
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Recently the U.S. and the south Korean warmongers agreed to deal in 259,000 tons out of the reserve ammunition and materiel for war stockpiled by the U.S. forces in south Korea. This indicates that the U.S. and the south Korean puppets are putting spurs to the preparations for a war of aggression against the north. 
					 Minju Joson today observes this in a signed commentary. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					It is the ulterior intention of the U.S. to realize its ambition to invade the north by using the south Korean puppet army as a shock brigade.
					
					The U.S. decision to deliver the above-mentioned ammunition and materiel to the puppet army is part of such moves. 
					
					If even an iota of national conscience had left in the Lee Myung Bak group, they would have taken up the cudgel against the crafty move of the U.S. to pit Koreans against themselves. 
					
					 It is great irony that the Lee group felt grateful for their American master's projected delivery of such things, regarding them as big gifts. 
					
					This only stripped bare once again the true colors of this traitorous clique as war servants for the U.S. 
					
					 The gravity of the said dealing is not confined to this. 
					
					The above-said group made much fuss over a small amount of fund spent in the course of the cooperation and exchange between compatriots for independent reunification and peace and prosperity, describing it as "drain on resources" but took the decision to purchase ammunition and materiel little short of scrap iron by spending the money collected from the people as taxes. This act of treachery can be perpetrated only by such diehard warmongers keen on confrontation with compatriots and sycophants and traitors serving the U.S. as Lee Myung Bak.
					
					 The situation on the Korean Peninsula where the atmosphere of reconciliation, unity and peace once prevailed is inching close to the phase of distrust, confrontation and war due to the wicked traitorous group's sycophancy towards the U.S. and their moves for confrontation with compatriots.
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that the puppets will get more frantic in the moves for a war of aggression against the north once they take over the above-mentioned things from the U.S. forces.
					
					Consequently, tension will further increase on the peninsula and the situation there will lead to the brink of a war. Then all Koreans may suffer the disaster of a new war, a nuclear war. 
					
					 In order to prevent such disaster not only south Koreans but all other Koreans should turn out in the anti-Lee struggle.

articles.title: Stop to Suppression of Candlelight Actions Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Stop to Suppression of Candlelight Actions Demanded in S. Korea
Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- The Democratic Labor Party of south Korea held a meeting to vow to put an end to the suppression of the candlelight struggle and punish the chief culprit responsible for economic bankruptcy in Seoul on Oct. 18.
					Speakers at the meeting denounced the Lee Myung Bak group for intensifying the investigation into people from all walks of life these days under the pretext of "eliminating pro-north leftist forces." 
					
					Accusing the Lee group of deteriorating the people's living by pursuing a policy of serving outside forces, they vowed to struggle for economic recovery and democracy.
					
					They urged the Lee group to stop the crackdown upon the candlelight struggle and set forth a policy for stabilizing the people's living, in stead of working hard to evade the blame for the expropriation of subsidies to rice cultivators.

articles.title: Candlelight Rally Held in Seoul
articles.content:
Candlelight Rally Held in Seoul
Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- A candlelight rally was held in Seoul under the sponsorship of the "Emergency Measure Committee for Probe into Truth of Terrorism against Citizens who Participated in Candlelight Actions" of south Korea on October 18.
					It was attended by at least 4,000 citizens and students including members of the political parties and civic and social organizations.
					
					Speakers at the rally recalled that of late the Lee Myung Bak group's fascist suppression of the participants of candlelight actions and the police and prosecution authorities' carrot-and-stick actions pursuant to its policy and moves of the ultra-rightist conservative organizations to rewrite history textbooks are getting evermore undisguised. They called for intensifying the anti-"government" struggle.
					
					They expressed their will to eliminate the remnants of the pro-U.S. dictatorship at any cost by escalating the struggle against Lee and conservatism.
					
					A resolution on actions read out there accused traitor Lee and the conservative groups of trying to cover up their treacherous and unpopular acts with the outdated veil of "ideological confrontation."
					
					The resolution called on the people from all walks of life to turn out in candlelight actions to judge traitor Lee and ultra-rightist conservative organizations threatening the right of the citizens to existence and keen to eliminate the progressive forces.

articles.title: Normalization of Japan-DPRK Relations Urged
articles.content:
Normalization of Japan-DPRK Relations Urged
Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- The Liaison Council for Denuclearization and Peace in Northeast Asia and Normalization of Relations between Japan and DPRK submitted a written request to the Japanese Foreign Ministry on Oct. 8 demanding the Japanese government build confidence between the two countries by lifting sanctions against the DPRK and rendering humanitarian assistance to it, and resume the talks for the normalization of relations as early as possible.
					Among those present at the action for the submission of the request were Co-Representatives Sumiko Shimizu and Koichi Ishizaka and Deputy Secretary Generals Hirogazu Kitagowa and Takashi Isogawa of the council.

articles.title: Feats Performed by Kim Jong Il in Leading Party Hailed
articles.content:
Feats Performed by Kim Jong Il in Leading Party Hailed
Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- Figures of different countries hailed the feats performed by General Secretary Kim Jong Il in leading the party at celebrations held on the occasion of the 63rd anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					Hannu Harju, chairman of the Communist Workers' Party of Finland for the Peace and Socialism, said that the WPK is frustrating the moves of the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces to stifle the DPRK and stepping up the drive for socialist construction and the independent and peaceful reunification of the country under the leadership of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					S.N. Sserwanga, secretary general of the African Regional Committee of Friendship and Solidarity with the Korean People, and other speakers noted that the WPK which was founded by President Kim Il Sung and led by Kim Jong Il is a tested and powerful party which has led the just cause of the Korean people to victory for a long period of time and a mother party enjoying absolute trust from the popular masses. 
					
					The director of Administration of the Council of Art and Culture of the Ministry of Federal Capital Territory of Nigeria said that all victories and successes achieved by the Korean people are a product of the outstanding leadership of Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the WPK.

articles.title: Congratulatory Visits to DPRK Embassies and Missions by Personages of Different Countries
articles.content:
Congratulatory Visits to DPRK Embassies and Missions by Personages of Different Countries
 Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Party for Unity and Progress of Guinea headed by General Secretary Sekou Konate visited the DPRK embassy in Conakry on Oct. 9 to celebrate the 63rd founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					The delegation laid a floral basket before the full-length picture of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
					
					Pointing out that the revolutionary cause of Juche pioneered by Kim Il Sung has been successfully carried forward under the tested Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il, the general secretary referred to the fact that the Korean people have achieved great successes in their efforts to build a great prosperous and powerful nation and reunify the country.
					
					He expressed full support to the just cause of the Korean people and evinced his will to boost the relations between the Party for Unity and Progress of Guinea and the WPK in the future, too.
					
					Meanwhile, personages of different social strata including the deputy mayors of Nakhodka, Partizansk, Pokino and Artyom cities and deputy chief of the Mission of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Vladivostok and the chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea made congratulatory visits to the DPRK missions in their countries on Oct. 8 and 9.

articles.title: RPDC demanda a Japon solucionar pronto problema de "consoladoras"
articles.content:
RPDC demanda a Japon solucionar pronto problema de "consoladoras"
Pyongyang, 22 de octubre (ATCC) -- Al hacer uso de la palabra el dia 14 en la reunion de la tercera comision del 63o periodo de sesiones de la Asamblea General de la ONU, el delegado coreano demando a Japon solucionar pronto el problema de las ex "consoladoras sexuales" del viejo ejercito japones al ver correctamente la corriente de la epoca en que se piden disculpas y se indemnizan sinceramente tambien hoy los crimenes cometidos en la Segunda Guerra Mundial aunque paso mas de medio siglo.
					Es la invariable politica del gobierno de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, que toma por guia directriz la humano-centrica idea Juche, eliminar la discriminacion de la mujer de todo tipo y asegurar su igualdad al hombre, enfatizo el delegado coreano y continuo:
					
					Sin la liquidacion cabal del pasado criminal no se puede imaginar ni lograr nunca el progreso de la mujer del presente ni del futuro.
					
					El sistema de las "consoladoras sexuales" de las tropas japonesas, a que fueron sometidas en contra de su voluntad 200 mil coreanas durante la ocupacion de Corea por Japon, es el crimen antietico y un importante problema de DDHH que debe ser balanceado sin falta.
					
					En la historia mundial no se ha registrado ningun antecedente de que un ejercito obligara la vida de esclava sexual a las ninas de 10 y tantos anos de edad arrastrandolas por los campos de batalla.
					
					A pesar de esto, las autoridades japonesas no reconocen la responsabilidad estatal de este crimen y rehusan pedir sinceras disculpas e indemnizar a las victimas.
					
					Negar un crimen innegable deviene el crimen mas grande y significa la voluntad de repetirlo en el futuro.
					
					Aprovechamos esta ocasion para recordar que en el ultimo ano, hasta en los parlamentos de varios paises occidentales se aprobaron las resoluciones demandando la reflexion y la disculpa por el caso de "consoladoras sexuales".

articles.title: Firmado acuerdo entre PTC y PPRL
articles.content:
Firmado acuerdo entre PTC y PPRL
Pyongyang, 22 de octubre (ATCC) -- Quedo rubricado el dia 21 en esta capital el acuerdo sobre la cooperacion y el intercambio de delegaciones para 2008-2010 entre el Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el Partido Popular Revolucionario Lao.
					En la ceremonia de firmas participaron por la parte coreana el secretario Choe Thae Bok y el subjefe de departamento Kim Thae Jong, del CC del PTC, y otros funcionarios y, por la laosiana, los miembros de la delegacion del PPRL presidida por Thongloun Sisoulith, miembro del Buro Politico del Comite Central y presidente de la Comision de Relaciones Exteriores de este partido, vicepremier y canciller del gobierno, y el embajador lao en Corea Chaleune Warinthrasak.
					
					Choe Thae Bok y Thongloun Sisoulith suscribieron el documento.

articles.title: APJERP condena represion fascista de la banda de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
APJERP condena represion fascista de la banda de Lee Myung Bak
Pyongyang, 22 de octubre (ATCC) -- En una declaracion fechada 21, el portavoz de la Direccion Nortena de la Alianza Pannacional de Jovenes y Estudiantes para la Reunificacion de la Patria (APJERP) condeno a la banda de Lee Myung Bak que recientemente arresto forzosamente al presidente ejecutivo de la Solidaridad de Jovenes y Estudiantes para la Ejecucion de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio en virtud de la infame "ley de seguridad" coincidiendo con la represion contra la Solidaridad de Ejecucion de la Declaracion Conjunta Sur-Norte del Sur de Corea.
					La horda de  traidores, que tan pronto como tomo el "poder" recurre a la represion fascista, detuvo al presidente de la direccion surena de la APJERP en virtud de "la ley de seguridad" y le impuso la pena severa al cabo de someterlo a toda clase de persecuciones y sufrimientos, senala la declaracion y continua:
					
					En los ultimos dias, trata de eliminar completamente el "Consejo de Organizaciones Juveniles del Sur de Corea" que se ponia a la cabeza de la lucha por la independencia, la democracia y la reunificacion en el Sur de Corea calificandole de elemento “proenemigo”.
					
					La direccion nortena de la APJERP condena severamente las recrudescentes maniobras de represion de la banda de Lee Myung Bak calificandolas del crimen antidemocratico y anti-reunificacion  para  suprimir la ardiente aspiracion y voluntad de los jovenes y estudiantes tendentes a ejecutar hasta el fin la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre, y resucitar la epoca de la dictadura fascista del pasado en el Sur de Corea.
					
					Tal represion demuestra que esa horda niega las declaraciones arriba mencionadas y persigue solo el enfrentamiento con el Norte y la dictadura fascista.
					
					Las autoridades titeres deben tener presente que si toman de continuo el camino de enfrentamiento y el fascismo nadando contra la aspiracion de los connacionales a la reunificacion, no podran evitar su ruina, tienen que poner fin ahora mismo a sus maniobras de represion contra las progresistas fuerzas patrioticas por la reunificacion y poner sin demora en libertad a los jovenes, estudiantes y personalidades patrioticas arrestados y encarcelados  injustamente.

articles.title: ATCC comenta virulento proceder de Japon
articles.content:
ATCC comenta virulento proceder de Japon
Pyongyang, 22 de octubre (ATCC) -- Ultimamente, las acciones de Japon, que envenenan el ambiente de las conversaciones a 6 bandas, devienen uno de los topicos de la sociedad internacional.
					So pretexto de que no fue resuelto el "problema del secuestro", Japon dio prorroga a las medidas de sancion contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea e insiste en que no puede ofrecer a ella la asistencia energetica acordada en las conversaciones a 6 bandas.
					
					El "problema del secuestro" es un asunto bilateral que fue abordado hasta ahora entre Corea y Japon.
					
					Por lo tanto, no debe ser tratado por algun otro pais ni mucho menos en la cita a 6 partes.
					
					Sin embargo, Japon lo vincula con las conversaciones a 6 partes y niega la ejecucion de todos sus compromisos correspondientes al principio de "accion vs. accion", lo cual no es mas que una chapuceria de los que perdieron el juicio.
					
					Segun ya trascendidos, Estados Unidos anuncio recientemente que dejaria de definir a la RPDC como "pais que apoya el terrorismo". 
					
					Muy disgustado de esto, Japon trata de estorbar a toda costa la solucion del problema nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					A decir la verdad en cuanto al "problema de secuestro" de que acusa porfiadamente Japon a la RPDC, hasta la fecha, esta  hizo todo lo posible para resolverlo.
					
					En las conversaciones de Shenyang efectuadas en agosto, se logro un acuerdo de pasar a las acciones concretas para liquidar el desgraciado pasado y resolver los articulos pendientes entre Corea y Japon.
					
					A base de ese documento, se comprometieron a realizar la reinvestigacion del "problema del secuestro" y concordaron sus puntos detallados de ella como forma, metodos, plazo, etc.
					
					El mundo reconoce cuan magnanima y valiente es esta decision de la RPDC cuando se toma en cuenta que ese "problema del secuestro" no es nada en comparacion con los crimenes anti-eticos cometidos por los imperialistas japoneses en el siglo pasado, que todavia no fueron liquidados, tales como el arresto forzado de mas de 8 millones 400 mil coreanos, la matanza de mas de un millon, la conversion de 200 mil coreanas en las "consoladoras sexuales" de las tropas japonesas, etc.
					
					Pero, Japon respondio con sus sistematicos actos traidores a la sinceridad de la RPDC y siempre hace cosas que obstaculizan la solucion del problema.
					
					Realmente, no hay nada que Japon coopero con la RPDC para resolver el "problema del secuestro". Lo unico que hizo el pais isleno fue revocar siempre sus compromisos.
					
					Retuvo a las personas que habia prometido devolver, prolongo las medidas de sancion que habia jurado levantar aun en lo parcial y reprimio mas brutalmente los derechos humanos de los coreanos residentes en Japon lejos de protegerlos. 
					
					Mas generosidad de la RPDC produjo mas hostilidad anti-RPDC, mas xenofobia a los coreanos y mas medidas de sancion en Japon. 
					
					 Despues de las conversaciones en Shenyang, las cosas no cambiaron.
					
					 Al dar enfasis al articulo del acuerdo sobre el "problema del secuestro" y menospreciar o restar los detalles de los demas articulos en direccion a inculcar la hostilidad a la RPDC, Japon engano a la opinion publica mundial como si la cita de Shenyang hubiera tratado solamente el "problema del secuestro" y evadio asi astutamente su deber de tomar medidas practicas para la creacion del ambiente a favor del mejoramiento de las relaciones bilaterales. 
					
					A traves del proceso de discusion y manejo del "problema del secuestro" entre ambos paises, se conocio perfectamente que este tema no pasa de ser en Japon un aparato para alcanzar los malsanos objetivos como el mantenimiento y la conquista del poder de algunas fuerzas politicas. 
					
					En particular, el nuevo poder de Aso repite la brutal politica hostil a Corea del regimen de Abe actuando hipocritamente como si respetara el acuerdo alcanzado con la RPDC durante el mandato de Fukuda. 
					
					Japon vincula el "problema del secuestro" con las conversaciones a 6 bandas y niega el cumplimiento del principio de "accion vs. accion" con el fin de llevar al fracaso las conversaciones y justificar sus maniobras hostiles a la RPDC y sus cruentas violaciones de DDHH de los coreanos residentes en su pais. 
					
					Es indudable que seran complicadas las conversaciones a 6 bandas cuando participe este pais que obstaculiza la solucion del "problema del secuestro" insistiendo en la absurda y paradojica teoria de que no debe haber avances en el proceso de desnuclearizacion antes de que fuera resuelto este problema.
					
					La RPDC se ve obligada a reflexionar de nuevo en la necesidad de la presencia de Japon en las conversaciones a 6 bandas dado que este pais isleno desafia lo acordado en la cita a 6 partes.
					
					Japon debe reflexionar de las consecuencias que emanen de sus viles actos y abandonar tal intento absurdo de tomar la desnuclearizacion como rehen del "problema del secuestro".

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun cuestiona presencia de Japon en conversaciones
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun cuestiona presencia de Japon en conversaciones
Pyongyang, 22 de octubre (ATCC) -- En estos momentos Japon volvio a decidir la prolongacion de un semestre de las medidas de sancion contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea e insiste en que mientras no se ve algun avance en la solucion del problema del secuestro no cumplira su obligacion de compensacion economica, acordada en las conversaciones a 6 bandas. 
					Revela asi el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual difundido en su edicion de este miercoles y continua: 
					
					La cita a 6 bandas no es para discutir el problema del secuestro, sino para resolver el problema nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Sin embargo, siempre que se sentaba a la mesa de de conversaciones Japon creo complicaciones y puso obstaculos recurriendo obstinadamente al problema del secuestro que no tiene nada que ver con la discusion del tema principal.
					
					So pretexto del problema del secuestro, el pais isleno no cumplio nada de lo acordado en la cita a 6 bandas y se desespero tenazmente por persuadir a EE.UU. para que no tache a la RPDC de la lista de "paises que apoyan el terrorismo". 
					
					Japon esta disgustado con la eliminacion de la RPDC de la lista de "paises que apoyan el terrorismo", de modo que frena la ejecucion del acuerdo del 3 de Octubre y se opone a las conversaciones a 6 bandas. 
					
					Cada vez que se sustituye el poder estatal, este pais isleno cambia su posicion y deja lo todo que hacia. Pues, discutir y solucionar los problemas pendientes con este sera un malgasto de tiempo.
					
					Japon conduce en error a la opinion publica como si no se alcanzara avance en la solucion de los asuntos pendientes Corea-Japon por falta de sinceridad de la primera. 
					
					Califica la reciente medida de EE.UU. de una "concesion" y "traicion". 
					
					Es una tonteria de enano politico el proceder de Japon de aprovechar la cita a 6 bandas como una escena para realizar su ambicion egoista.
					
					La compensacion economica a la RPDC es la obligacion segun el acuerdo del 3 de octubre. El avance de las conversaciones a 6 bandas depende de la ejecucion de este acuerdo.
					
					La negacion de esta obligacion significa el impedimento abierto al acuerdo del 3 de Octubre  para  llevar al fracaso las conversaciones.
					
					La intencion de Japon es crear dificultad y complicaciones ante las negociaciones de 6 paises, frenar la solucion de los problemas y mantener de continuo la situacion tensa en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Aunque sea desde ahora, Japon debe abandonar los actos imprudentes.
